verses.text: 喜歡誇自己的軟弱誇口固然無益，卻也是必要的。現在我要說說主的異象和啟示。

words.note: Commonly used in biblical contexts for human frailty.
Lit. 'to boast with the mouth'.
Reduplication of '說' (to speak) implies a casual or brief action.
A respectful title for God or Jesus in Christianity.
Often refers to divine visions in religious texts.
Refers to divine communication or disclosure.

verses.text: 我認識一個在基督裡的人，他十四年前被提到第三層天上去。（是帶著身體被提的呢？我不知道，是離開了身體呢？我也不知道，只有 神知道。）

words.note: Transliteration of 'Christos' (Greek).
Refers to the dwelling place of God/spirits.

verses.text: 我認識這個人，
他被提到樂園裡去，聽見了難以言喻的話，那是人不可以說的。

words.note: Lit. 'joyful garden'; refers to heaven or Eden.

verses.text: 為了這個人，我要誇口，但為了我自己，除了我的軟弱以外，我沒有可誇的。

words.note: Lit. 'to boast with the mouth'.
Commonly used in biblical contexts for human frailty.

verses.text: 即使我想誇口，也不算愚妄，因為我要說的是真話。但我閉口不提，免得有人把我看得太高，過於他在我身上所見所聞的。

words.note: Lit. 'boast with mouth'
Often used in a moral or spiritual sense in the Bible.
Lit. 'avoid getting'
Grammatical particle for object-preposing.
Lit. 'exceed in'
Forms a nominal phrase like 'that which is seen'.
Forms a nominal phrase like 'that which is heard'.

verses.text: 又因為我所得的啟示太大，恐怕會高抬自己，所以就有一根刺加在我的身上，就是撒但的差役來攻擊我，免得我高抬自己。

words.note: Forms a nominal phrase like 'that which is obtained'.
In this context, often means 'become conceited'.
Transliteration of Hebrew/Greek 'Satan'.
Refers to an agent sent to perform a task.
Lit. 'avoid getting'
In this context, often means 'become conceited'.

verses.text: 為了這事，我曾經三次求主，使這根刺離開我。

words.note: Refers to God or Christ in a religious context.

verses.text: 他卻對我說：「我的恩典是夠你用的，因為我的能力在人的軟弱上顯得完全。」所以，我更喜歡誇自己的軟弱，好讓基督的能力臨到我的身上。

words.note: Refers to divine favor or blessing.
Forms a nominal phrase like 'that which is for your use'.
Indicates 'in the aspect of' or 'concerning'.
Transliteration of Greek 'Christos'.

verses.text: 因此，我為基督的緣故，就以軟弱、凌辱、艱難、迫害、困苦為喜樂，因為我甚麼時候軟弱，甚麼時候就剛強了。

words.note: Transliteration of Greek 'Christos'.
Often used in the structure 'X 為 Y' meaning 'regard X as Y'.
Refers to spiritual joy, often profound and lasting.
The repetition of '甚麼時候...甚麼時候就...' translates to 'whenever...then...'.
The repetition of '甚麼時候...甚麼時候就...' translates to 'whenever...then...'.

verses.text: 表明愛哥林多教會的心我成了愚妄的人，是你們逼成的。其實你們應該稱讚我，因為我雖然算不得甚麼，卻沒有一點比不上那些「超等使徒」。

words.note: Indicates emphasis on the preceding phrase.
Indicates something is not worth counting or considering.

verses.text: 我在你們中間，以各種忍耐，用神蹟、奇事和大能，作為使徒的憑據。
除了我自己沒有成為你們的重擔以外，你們還有甚麼比不上別的教會呢？這一點委屈，請原諒我吧！

words.note: Often used in religious context for spiritual or financial burdens.

words.definition: a little bit, this small matter

verses.text: 好了，我打算第三次到你們那裡去，這一次也不會成為你們的重擔，因為我所要的不是你們的東西，而是你們自己。兒女不需要為父母積財，父母卻應該為兒女積財。

words.note: Indicates completion or a transition; used as an interjection.
Often used in religious context for spiritual or financial burdens.
Forms a nominal phrase with a following verb, indicating 'that which'.
Idiomatic, originally meaning 'east and west'.

verses.text: 至於我，我甘心樂意為你們的靈魂付上一切，鞠躬盡瘁。難道我越愛你們，就越得不到你們的愛嗎？

words.note: An idiom expressing a joyful and willing disposition.
上 here implies completion or giving fully.
A classical idiom expressing extreme dedication and self-sacrifice.
Used to pose a rhetorical question, implying surprise or doubt.

verses.text: 算了！我沒有成為你們的重擔，卻是個狡猾的人，用詭計牢籠你們。

words.note: Often used in religious contexts for spiritual burdens.
Literally 'prison cage'; figuratively 'to trap or confine'.

verses.text: 我派到你們那裡去的人，我藉著誰佔過你們的便宜？
我勸提多到你們那裡去，又派了那位弟兄一同去。提多佔過你們的便宜嗎？我們行事，不是同一個心靈嗎？不是同樣的步伐嗎？

words.note: Commonly used in Christian contexts for male believers.
The phrase 佔便宜 (zhànpiányi) means 'to take advantage'.
Often refers to the spiritual or inner being in religious texts.

verses.text: 你們一直以為我們是在向你們申辯嗎？我們是在基督裡，當著 神面前說話的。親愛的，一切事都是為了建立你們。

words.note: The raised character indicates reverence for God.
A common term of endearment in Christian epistles.
In biblical context, often refers to spiritual building or edification.

verses.text: 我怕我來的時候，見你們不如我所想的，你們見我也不如你們所想的。又怕有紛爭、嫉妒、惱怒、自私、毀謗、讒言、狂傲、混亂的事。

words.note: Often listed as a vice in scripture.
Often listed as a vice in scripture.
Often listed as a vice in scripture.
Often listed as a vice in scripture.
Often listed as a vice in scripture.
Often listed as a vice in scripture.
Often listed as a vice in scripture.
Often listed as a vice in scripture.

verses.text: 又怕我再來的時候，我的 神使我在你們面前羞愧；並且我要為許多從前犯罪的人哀痛，因為他們行了污穢、姦淫、邪蕩的事，卻不肯悔改。

words.note: Connects verb/clause to following noun/time
Capitalized to denote the singular God
Verb-object compound
Forms an adjectival phrase
Connects adjectives/clauses to following noun
Lit. 'regret and change'
